dt: {bc}a usually grilled sandwich made with Italian bread

{it}Panini{/it} is a plural form in Italian but is commonly used as both a singular and a plural in English. Its use as a singular has given rise the variant plural form {it}paninis{/it}. The use of {it}panino{/it} as a singular form in English has become relatively uncommon as {it}panini{/it} has become established as the usual singular.

dt.t: On each visit, someone at our table invariably orders a {wi}panini{/wi} …
At the back of the shop are {wi}paninis{/wi}, freshly brewed coffee and two tubs of homemade soups.

et: Italian, diminutive of {it}pane{/it} bread, from Latin {it}panis{/it} {ma}{mat|food|}{/ma}
shortdef: a usually grilled sandwich made with Italian bread
